title: Latin America & the Caribbean : homicide rates 2017 , by country
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
The maximum Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants 61.8 is found at Country El Salvador and the minimum is found at Chile where Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is 4.3.
The difference of Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants between the highest and lowest Country is 57.5.

max_summary: This bar chart has 22 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants 61.8 is found at Country El Salvador and the minimum is found at Chile where Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is 4.3.
The second highest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is appeared to be the Country .
There is a difference of 57.5 between the maximum Country El Salvador and minimum Country Chile.
Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants at Country El Salvador is 61.8 , second place is  at 61.8, and thirdly is Honduras at 41.7.
The average Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in all 22 Countrys is 20.79.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is 457.4 if we add up values of all Countrys.
